discussion.content:
C. .tsv

The correct extension for a tab-delimited spreadsheet file is .tsv, which stands for Tab-Separated Values. In a tab-delimited file, data values are separated by tabs, with each row representing a separate record or entry in the dataset. The .tsv extension is commonly used to denote files in this format.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the correct extension for a tab-delimited spreadsheet file?

discussion.content:
B. Consolidation

Consolidation involves combining or merging similar data across multiple fields into a single field. In this scenario, where a dataset with 40 fields needs to be pared down to 20 fields and contains similar data across multiple fields, consolidation would be the appropriate concept to apply. By consolidating redundant or similar data into fewer fields, the dataset becomes more streamlined and efficient, making it easier to manage and analyze.

questions.question_text: Which of the following concepts should be applied if a data set with 40 fields needs to be pared down to 20 fields and contains similar data across multiple fields?

discussion.content: D. Python is a common data analytics tool that is also used as an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language. Python is popular among data analysts and data scientists because of its simplicity, flexibility, and powerful data processing and visualization libraries. Python is often used to perform data manipulation, exploration, and analysis tasks, and can be used to build machine learning models, data pipelines, and data visualizations. The other options (SAS, Microsoft Power BI, and IBM SPSS) are also data analytics tools, but they are not programming languages.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a common data analytics tool that is also used as an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language?

discussion.content:
D. Data governance is the availability, usability, integrity, and security of data in an enterprise.

Data governance is primarily concerned with establishing policies, processes, and controls to ensure that data assets are managed effectively and in accordance with organizational requirements. This includes ensuring that data is available when needed, is usable and understandable by relevant stakeholders, maintains its integrity and quality, and is secured against unauthorized access or breaches. This definition encompasses the broader scope of data governance beyond specific tasks like data visualization or analysis, focusing instead on the overall management and stewardship of data within an organization.

choices.A: Data governance governs the development of a data visualization dashboard in an organization.
choices.B: Data governance is the policy that protects against data breaches by cybercriminals.
choices.C: Data governance is the process of analyzing, manipulating, and reporting data in an organization.
choices.D: Data governance is the availability, usability, integrity and security of data in an enterprise.
